Hi,

In recent discussions about xml:href, xml:src, xml:rel, xml:type,  xml=
:hreflang , xml:method and xml:tref on xml-dev, I've been persuaded that th=
e best/fasted way to turn XML into a hypermedia language is to initiate a W=
3C Community Group dedicated to this subject, where community opinion can b=
e gathered and represented.

http://www.w3.org/community/groups/proposed/#x=
mlhypermedia

So far, the idea has received some support, but I feel that t=
here is a lot of latent support out there, and some focused application of =
hypermedia expertise is all that is required to help XML to become a native=
 hypermedia language.

The bugzilla bug on this topic is here:

https://www=
.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=3D17659

I hope that you will consider =
joining the W3C XML Hypermedia Community Group, in that any changes to W3C =
standards must be driven by user requirements, and the Community Groups are=
 designed to gather those.   So, if I've misrepresented the requirements, p=
lease join and help clarify them.  If you agree with the requirements, plea=
se join to show your support.  The more members, the better the chance of c=
hange.

Thank you!

Peter
